msgSnippet: ... Is ... careful ... As of right now GreenBar is not a part of JUnit, I just stuck it in the junit.jar. It seemed the least painful thing to do as I am using
messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., "Erik Hanson" <ehanson@n...> wrote:
> "Erik Meade" <emeade@g...> wrote:
> > A recent email from Frank Westphal prompted me to cleanup
> > GreenBar and throw it into the mix. GreenBar is a very
> > simple UI for JUnit. It consists of a bar which behaves
> > much as the bar on the gui TestRunners. Once all of the
> > tests have run the bar slowly counts back down. It
> > remembers its location and size. Check out the
> > junit.properties in the user home directory for properties
> > you can configure. Information is printed out to
> > System.out as I run it in IntelliJ, which captures
> > System.out.
> >
> > http://www.geekfarm.org/emeade/junit/GreenBar.zip
>
> That file contains junit.jar, which has all of JUnit plus GreenBar.
Is
> GreenBar going to be part of JUnit from now on, or do I have to be
careful
> when installing a newer version of JUnit?
>
>
> Erik

As of right now GreenBar is not a part of JUnit, I just stuck it in
the junit.jar. It seemed the least painful thing to do as I am using
a slightly modified junit.runner.BaseTestRunner. You can see the
modifications here:
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.phpfunc=detail&aid=443255&group_i
d=15278&atid=315278
The modifications allow a subclass of BaseTestRunner to set and save
preferences.

When a newer version of JUnit comes out I will provide an update.
